comment: Grades kind of harshly on essays, but discussion questions are essentially easy 100s. Very easy to contact, she lists her personal phone number on her syllabus page, and actually answers the phone. Had a great experience with her.

So many stories to read, but theres always sparknotes! Quizzes/tests aren't super hard but you need to know the story very well to pass. Discussions are easy she gives a rubric. 1 essay and 1 project, nothing too hard. Quizlet has great review flashcards that helped me get an A. Never spoke to her personally so cant say how she is, but easy class
She is an AMAZING professor! I feel like I actually learned things through her readings. The assignments were easy and shes not a tough grader! I definitely recommend taking her for English.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: This professor assigned weekly reading, which is expected in an English class, however, it was frequently just busywork. I don't feel like I learned anything of value in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Mosley is very helpful, after grading papers she gives good feedback. She is a little bit of tough grader, but her feedback helps you not make the same mistakes. Every week there is a reading from the textbook and 1 or 2 discussion posts, it is easy grades and mandatory to pass. I would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: For this class there are discussion posts on reading from the textbook every week, 3 papers, 3 peer reviews, and a final in which you write a paper based on reading from the textbook in 2 hours. Completing the reading and discussion posts are easy, but essential. Rubics for essays are a little unclear and I disagree with how she grades papers.
Shes actually a great online professor! Great feedback, its impossible to fail unless you really just dont try at all.

Be prepared to be scrutinized by someone whose actual quizzes, tests, announcements, etc. are riddled with spelling errors. She knows the material, but she seriously can't write to save her life. Despite that, it's an easy online class (no Respondus). You have to do the discussion posts before she grants access to quizzes.

Mrs. Mosley is a pleasant and nice woman, obviously knowledgeable about English as a subject. She pales when it comes to teaching English to native English speakers. She herself speaks English as a second language, and routinely makes grammatical mistakes. The class wasn't that hard, but your best works will go unappreciated.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Caring

comment: Nearly done with the class online, have an A in the course at the moment. Extremely easy and well organized. Of course you have to read the stories and actually spend a few hours on the papers... Nothing is new here. She is not going to give you an A for just signing up for the class. Not too much work just put in a little effort.

I took this course online ,  GET THE TEXTBOOKS ! There is a discussion post every week over a short story , She will give you a 0 if not submitted by the date on the Syllabus , OVERALL she seemed very understanding with papers , yes she grades prettty tough . ALL In all , I passed , FOLLOW THE SYLLABUS ! Shes a great help via Email.

Super easy, got a B without even trying, a bit of busy work but she is very helpful and emails right back to any question or concern. Grading is super easy just follow the formats required. Very nice and helpful. Just a lot of participation in discussions and reading short essays. I recommend for an easy credit.

I don't get the harsh comments: this was an easy class & professor! I took the online summer course & got a B, & this was not even trying as hard as I should have. It is VERY demanding though...but everything is graded for completion except the essays, & she does not grade hard. Also, the schedule may seem confusing at first but stay organized

**STAY AWAY** She's a harsh grader that cannot explain why she takes off points. Trying to communicate to her through email is nearly impossible as she does everything she can to evade giving a straight answer. She does not teach, only grades papers. She will leave you shaking your head.

Mentally scattered & unorganized (we're on syllabus amendment 12). Grades harshly yet doesn't read complete papers. 20hrs+ busy work/wk. Flawed English. Her syllabus is an unprofessional trainwreck compiled by a 1st grader. Makes excuses for grading delays. No continuity to her MLA formatting.

I took the class online, which was a HUGE mistake in the first place. She gives you a lot of busy work. I did expect reading journals, but she made you write the summaries twice, once as an assignment and the other for attendance. I wouldn't recommend her, but I wouldn't recommend taking ENGL 1102 online. You have better luck in a classroom.
I took her class online. She graded pretty harsh on the papers but other assignments were for completion only so I still came out with an A. I'd take her again.

Follow the directions EXACTLY if you want to do well.Her directions are terrible so ask her to clarify them.I started off badly, but quickly brought my grade to an A. Lots of busy work, but it's not hard. Gives plenty of time for assignments. Easy Easy Easy A!!!
This professor was not very professional. She gave samples that were full of typos. She graded really harshly and not very clearly.
Great
! Warning Warning.....If u take this class just minus 5 point off your GPA now.....For REAL......RUNNNNNNNNNN
she taught me actually at etowah last year. she's not clear and she gave me bad grades for nothing. she won't even expain what you did wrong. her class was frustrating

She is a very nice person, but not very professional. She is very unclear about the tasks and her expectations as well as grounds for the grades. I got A, but I would not recommend her if you're really looking to improve your writing skills. If you write well you will be fine. Don't panic if you are in her class just keep asking for clarification.

I took her online English class (which was a mistake, no matter which professor I would have chosen).  It may have been easier to have an in-class course.  Her syllabus was very unclear and had many errors.  She gives harsh grades, and sometimes does not really explain her reasoning.
She is not helpful and grades very hard. Very disappointed with her lack of help and clarity. Unless you are an English Major choose another teacher
She was not helpful at all.

Most of assignments are graded on completion so there are a lot of easy grades. She grades papers hard, and won't read them before hand to help you out, but she will let you revise them for a B or better.  Overall, she's a good teacher and I recommend her, she gives you a fairly easy B, but not an easy A
Her class is very easy! She will help you with anything you need! I wish I would of had her for my English 101 class! Best Teacher for Eng. Yet!

She won't beg you to learn. She helps those who show initiative and put forth effort.  I was worried about my grade after the first essay but as long as you do your work and stay on task you will be fine. There is plenty of work to be done, but most is graded on completion. I recommend
SHE'S VERY SWEET AND WILL DO ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING TO MAKE YOU GET A GOOD GRADE. SHE DOES NOT WANT ANYONE TO FAIL AND IS VERY VERY HELPFUL. SHE'S ONE OF THE GREATEST ENGLISH TEACHERS!!
No Comments
One of the best teachers in Kennesaw State! Always willing and finding ways to help students make good grades.
